office:text.text:p: KolourPaint 4.0.0preDeveloper Guide
http://www.kolourpaint.org/
Clarence Dang
<clarencedang AT users.sourceforge.net>
Revision: 2006-11-20
This document has not reached a useful level of maturity yet.
Like software, it is a work-in-progress.

Chapter 1

This document is a concise and thorough guide containing all the knowledge needed to maintain and modify KolourPaint. Where possible it points to existing, high-quality information instead of duplicating it here. TODO: not thorough yet.
TODO: Merge all the docs in branches/kolourpaint/control.
TODO means something that we need to do document-wise.
ACTION means something that we need to code-wise or project-wise.
CITE means we need to add a reference (Insert / Indexes and Tables ... / Bibliography Entry / From document content).
This is a generated file.
Use https://svn.kde.org/home/kde/branches/kolourpaint/control/Makefile to regenerate this file (see inside that Makefile for details).

Please use OpenOffice.org 2.0.0 to edit this document, to minimise formatting changing pecularities. Press F11 to enable the Styles and Formatting window and select the Applied Styles filter. Press F5 to enable the Navigator window. Dock both to the left of the main view.
Every so often, click Tools / Update / Update All to regenerate generated fields (e.g. The Table of Contents and the Bibliography).

Separate sentences by two spaces out of stubborn old-fashion-ness.

Chapter 2
TODO

text:list-item.text:p: Rewriting graphics engine to be device-independent
Implement often requested features esp. 8-bit and alpha support
Continual refinement to make it easier to use

office:text.text:p: It is a cathedral by accident, like DOSEMU. It should be – and now tries to be – a Bazaar.
Many people have contributed to KolourPaint. However, here are the people who would have in-depth knowledge of the project:

Clarence Dang <clarencedang AT users.sourceforge.net> is the founder, main developer and maintainer. He wishes more people would jump in and contribute. Clarence drew the initial (and hopeless) icons using KolourPaint itself, until Kristof Borrey jumped on board.
Thurston Dang <thurston_dang AT users.sourceforge.net> provides advice on user interfaces changes and wrote the DocBook documentation (kdegraphics/doc/kolourpaint).

Kazuki Ohta <mover AT hct.zaq.ne.jp> wrote the InputMethod support. He does not seem to reply to Clarence's email anymore. The InputMethod support has been disabled in KolourPaint for KDE4 as it has not been ported. ACTION: port
Kristof Borrey <borrey AT kde.org> drew the original set of icons.
Nuno Pinheiro <nf.pinheiro AT gmail.com> and Danny Allen <dannya40uk AT yahoo.co.uk> replaced most of the icons with newer ones.
Initial versions held on Clarence Dang's hard disk. ACTION: upload onto internet.
After a while, this was moved into KDE CVS.

KDE then converted the repository to KDE SVN. The source code can be modified by anyone with an SVN account [CITE]. Either ask for an account, or send patches to <kolourpaint-support AT lists.sourceforge.net>.
branches/kolourpaint/control/ - persistent, documentation and non-source code information
trunk/KDE/kdegraphics/{doc/,}kolourpaint – current development branch porting to KDE 4 and containing all future feature development
branches/KDE/3.5/kdegraphics/{doc/,}kolourpaint – backport branch for KDE 3
branches/KDE/3.4/kdegraphics/{doc/,}kolourpaint – obsolete backport branch (only port critical fixes for distros that love old software)
branches/KDE/3.3/kdegraphics/{doc/,}kolourpaint – only port critical fixes for distros that love old software)
branches/kolourpaint/1.2_kde3/ - dead, standalone release branch for KDE 3.0 (we still need to extract the binary distribution scripts from there, for future standalone releases)
branches/kolourpaint/1.0/ - dead, standalone release branch for KDE 3.0
http://sourceforge.net/projects/kolourpaint/ is the Sourceforge project. The admin, Clarence Dang <clarencedang AT users.sourceforge.net>, can give you access to this.
The website is http://kolourpaint.sourceforge.net/. You need a Sourceforge account to modify the webpage via SSH at shell.sourceforge.net:/home/groups/k/ko/kolourpaint/htdocs/.
The website is currently stored on Clarence Dang's computer using CVS and copied to that path every so often. The HTML is edited directly. We should use a CMS instead.
ACTION: It would be better if this site was hosted on KDE SVN and maintained by an interested web developer.
TODO: mailing lists. Bugs.kde.org TODO: freshmeat.net (clarencedang AT users.sourceforge.net>) TODO: kde-apps.org <dang AT kde.org>
http://www.kolourpaint.org/ is currently a Namesecure domain that redirects to http://kolourpaint.sourceforge.net/. The registrant is Clarence Dang, who pays for the domain.

http://www.kolourpaint.com/ is registered by Clarence Dang for commercialisation possibilities and to prevent someone else from misrepresenting the project. We are not really concerned about kolourpaint.net, kolourpaint.com.au etc. since they are odd domains anyway while .org and .com are very ordinary.
ACTION: It would be better to hide the fact that it redirects as www.kolourpaint.org looks more professional.

ACTION: Switch away from namesecure since that don't provide free email forwarding anymore – would like to have <support AT kolourpaint.org> - and their email forwarding was unreliable anyway. Sitelutions.net is recommended by David Greenaway.
Currently only happens between Clarence Dang and Thurston Dang (out of convenience), which is disappointing. ACTION: use kolourpaint-devel mailinglist more.
